body.p: Elements in bold are designated "Core" in LC-PCC PS or "routinely record" in the MLA Best Practices.

li.b: Manifestation: publisher number for notated music
Manifestation: plate number for notated music

ul.li: Manifestation: identifier for expression

row.entry: Identifier TypeIdentifier types specified in the MARC format but not in RDA given in parentheses.
(ISMN)May be used for 10-character (beginning with M) and 13-character (beginning with 979-0) ISMNs.
(International Article Number (EAN))Formerly European Article Number. EANs, JANs (Japanese Article Numbers), and 13-digit ISMNs all conform to the GTIN-13 standard and may be recorded in 024 3x.
(International Standard Recording Code (ISRC))ISRCs, when present, are assigned per each individual track, not per album.

section.title: Principal agent or MARC uniform title (MARC: 1xx)

li.b: Work: creator agent of work (or narrower element)

ul.li: Work: authorized access point for work (mixed or no responsibility)
Expression: authorized access point for expression (mixed or no responsibility)

section.title: Title information and associated statements of responsibility (MARC: 245)

ul.li:
Manifestation: title of manifestation
Manifestation: title proper
Manifestation: parallel title proper
Manifestation: variant title of manifestation
Manifestation: parallel other title information

Manifestation: statement of responsibility
Manifestation: statement of responsibility relating to title proper
Manifestation: parallel statement of responsibility relating to title proper

table.title: Title and Statement of Responsibility Summary

row.entry: statement of responsibility relating to title proper
parallel statement of responsibility relating to title proper

section.note: In certain cases involving compilations lacking a collective title, titles proper subsequent to the first must be recorded in $c because no further subfielding is permitted once $c has been recorded. In such cases, also record titles proper subsequent to the first (and any desired variants) in separate instances of field 740, second indicator value 2, to insure proper indexing.
section.p: For detailed guidance and examples of complex parallel data, consult .
Record variant titles in field 246 using indicator values 13, 1_ with an explanatory note in $i, or other values according to local practice, as appropriate.

ul.li: Manifestation: parallel designation of edition

li.b: Manifestation: designation of named revision of edition

ul.li: Manifestation: parallel designation of named revision of edition

li.b: Manifestation: statement of responsibility relating to edition

ul.li: Manifestation: parallel statement of responsibility relating to edition

Manifestation: statement of responsibility relating to named revision of edition
Manifestation: parallel statement of responsibility relating to named revision of edition

row.entry: Record separate designations of editions in separate instances of field 250.
designation of named revision of edition

If separate from a designation of edition, record in $a of a separate field 250. If grammatically linked to the designation of edition, record in $a following the designation of edition, separated by a comma. If subordinate to but not grammatically linked to a designation of edition or designation of named revision of edition, record in $b.
parallel designation of named revision of edition
statement of responsibility relating to edition
parallel statement of responsibility relating to edition
statement of responsibility relating to named revision of edition
parallel statement of responsibility relating to named revision of edition

Manifestation: base material

table.title: Other Manifestation and Expression Characteristics Summary

row.entry: Subfield(s)OCLC-specific mnemonic subfields given in parentheses.

section.note: For sound recordings, 007 byte 10 (kind of material) defines codes for applied material, base material, and applied and base materials together. Not all audio carriers have a valid combination of materials defined. See , .

ul.li:
Manifestation: other title information of series
Manifestation: parallel other title information of series

Manifestation: statement of responsibility relating to seriesRoutinely record the element if the series represents the complete or selected works of a single composer.
Manifestation: parallel statement of responsibility relating to series
Work: subseries
Work: authorized access point for work
Work: ISSN

row.entry: parallel other title information of series
Following the title or parallel title of series it pertains to (same $a)
statement of responsibility relating to series
Following the title, other title information, and/or subseries it pertains to (same $a)
parallel statement of responsibility relating to series
Following the parallel title, parallel other title, and/or subseries it pertains to (same $a)
Following all $a $x $y $z for series or subseries

entry.p: If series is numbered or if ISSN is recorded: following all $a $v $x $y $z for the parent series
If series is unnumbered and no ISSN is recorded: following title or parallel title of series (same $a)

row.entry: Following all $a and preceding $v for series or subseries
Following all $a and preceding $v for series or subseries
Following all $a and preceding $v for series or subseries

body.p: If a manifestation belongs to two or more series (that are not parent series and subseries), record each series in a separate instance of field 490.

row.entry: Access point for a work manifested as a series collecting works by a single creator
Access point for a work manifested as a series collecting works that do not have a single creator
Subseries, if traced and entered subordinately to the main series rather than under its own title

ul.li:
Manifestation: note on manifestation
Manifestation: note on title
Manifestation: note on statement of responsibility All narrower elements of Manifestation: note on manifestation have been soft-deprecated by the RDA Steering Committee. Although there are no immediate plans to remove those elements, in the future instructions specific to those narrower elements may be subsumed into Manifestation: note on manifestation or migrated to policy statements.
Manifestation: equipment or system requirement
Manifestation: manifestation described in

Expression: capture information
Expression: note on capture
Expression: expression described in

Expression: form of notation
Expression: script LC-PCC core for certain language/script combinations. For form of musical notation, see .
Expression: intended audience of expressionLC-PCC core for juvenile resources.
Expression: language of expression
Work: work described in

row.entry: Notes for which no more specific field is appropriate
Notes on bibliographies, discographies, or other included bibliographic references
Source of title, if required by LC-PCC PS
Full text of a thesis or dissertation statement.
Contents notes for collection aggregates or manifestations of works with named parts
Artistic or technical creation/production credits, including agents not named in a statement of responsibility
Performer or participant credits, including agents not named in a statement of responsibility
work, expression, or manifestation described in
Citations to reference works discussing the work, expression, or manifestation
Notes on place and/or date of recording for one or more expressions.
Date(s) of recording for one or more expressions
Place(s) of recording for one or more expressions
Notes on the target age, grade level, proficiency level, etc. of the intended audience
Notes on format and/or playback requirements for video carriers or nonstandard or specialized audio carriers
Notes on language(s) of the primary content of the resource
Script(s) of primary content. For form of musical notation, prefer field 348 $c unless required by local policy.
